# fwdslsh.dev

> fwdslsh provides developer tools for agent-friendly content distribution using the Rabit specification.

## Discovery

The fwdslsh tool ecosystem is discoverable via the burrow.json manifest at:

```
https://fwdslsh.dev/.well-known/burrow.json
```

## Quick Start with curl and jq

### Fetch the burrow manifest

```bash
curl -s https://fwdslsh.dev/.well-known/burrow.json | jq .
```

### List all available tools and resources

```bash
curl -s https://fwdslsh.dev/.well-known/burrow.json | jq -r '.entries[] | "\(.id)\t\(.kind)\t\(.title // .uri)"'
```

### Get metadata about a specific entry

```bash
curl -s https://fwdslsh.dev/.well-known/burrow.json | jq '.entries[] | select(.id == "ENTRY_ID")'
```

### Fetch an entry's content

```bash
# First get the entry URI
URI=$(curl -s https://fwdslsh.dev/.well-known/burrow.json | jq -r '.entries[] | select(.id == "ENTRY_ID") | .uri')

# Then fetch the content
curl -s "https://fwdslsh.dev/$URI"
```

### Search entries by keyword

```bash
curl -s https://fwdslsh.dev/.well-known/burrow.json | jq -r '.entries[] | select(.title // "" | ascii_downcase | contains("KEYWORD")) | "\(.id)\t\(.title)"'
```

### List entries by kind (file, dir, burrow, link)

```bash
curl -s https://fwdslsh.dev/.well-known/burrow.json | jq -r '.entries[] | select(.kind == "file") | .id'
```

### Get burrow title and description

```bash
curl -s https://fwdslsh.dev/.well-known/burrow.json | jq '{title, description, updated}'
```

### Count entries

```bash
curl -s https://fwdslsh.dev/.well-known/burrow.json | jq '.entries | length'
```

## Burrow Schema

A burrow.json manifest contains:

- **specVersion**: Schema version (e.g., "fwdslsh.dev/rabit/schemas/0.4.0/burrow")
- **kind**: Always "burrow"
- **title**: Human-readable name
- **description**: Brief description
- **updated**: RFC 3339 timestamp
- **entries**: Array of entry objects
- **repo**: Repository links (readme, license, contributing)
- **agents**: Context and hints for LLM agents

Each entry has:

- **id**: Unique identifier
- **kind**: Entry type (file, dir, burrow, map, link)
- **uri**: Location relative to burrow base
- **title**: Human-readable name
- **summary**: Brief description for agents
- **mediaType**: MIME type
- **tags**: Categorization array
- **priority**: Higher values indicate importance

## fwdslsh Tools

### rabit-client

TypeScript reference implementation for traversing burrows and warrens.

- Repository: https://github.com/fwdslsh/rabit/tree/main/packages/rabit-client
- Transport: HTTPS, HTTP, file://, Git, SMB, NFS
- Features: SHA256 verification, caching, rate limiting

### rabit-mcp

Model Context Protocol plugin for Claude and AI assistants.

- Repository: https://github.com/fwdslsh/rabit/tree/main/packages/rabit-mcp
- Tools: discover, fetch, list, search, traverse burrows and warrens

### rabit-server

Docker-based servers for hosting burrows.

- Repository: https://github.com/fwdslsh/rabit/tree/main/packages/rabit-server
- Variants: HTTP server with auto-generation, Git server with SSH auth

### opencode-rabit

OpenCode IDE plugin for Rabit integration.

- Repository: https://github.com/fwdslsh/rabit/tree/main/packages/opencode-rabit
- Features: Browse, search, and traverse burrows from your IDE

## Traversing Nested Burrows

Burrows can contain nested burrows (kind: "burrow"). To traverse:

```bash
# Get nested burrow entries
NESTED_URI=$(curl -s https://fwdslsh.dev/.well-known/burrow.json | jq -r '.entries[] | select(.kind == "burrow") | .uri' | head -1)

# Fetch the nested burrow manifest
curl -s "https://fwdslsh.dev/${NESTED_URI}.burrow.json" | jq .
```

## Warren Discovery

A warren is a registry of multiple burrows. Check for a warren at:

```bash
curl -s https://fwdslsh.dev/.well-known/warren.json | jq .
```

List all burrows in a warren:

```bash
curl -s https://fwdslsh.dev/.well-known/warren.json | jq -r '.burrows[] | "\(.id)\t\(.title)\t\(.uri)"'
```

## Specification

Full Rabit v0.4.0 specification: https://github.com/fwdslsh/rabit/blob/main/docs/rabit-spec.md

## Optional

- Documentation: https://fwdslsh.dev/docs/
- Source: https://github.com/fwdslsh/rabit
- Bash client example: https://github.com/fwdslsh/rabit/blob/main/examples/client/bash/rabit.sh
